item.title: Essential metrics for classification tasks
item.description: Introduction A machine learning classification problem refers to the task of predicting the class of a sample given its features. Usually, these problems are divided into three types: binary, multiclass, and multilabel classification. The difference is simple. When the problem is formed by only two classes, for instance, predict if the genre of a book is fiction or non-fiction or if a news is fake or not, it is called binary classification.
